See also H. Ginn to W. Lonsdale, 2 March 1853.]
With reference to your Letter of the 19th March last No 3321, authorizing the purchase of a Horse for the Botanic Gardens at an expenditure of Sixty pounds, I do myself the honor to request His Excellency the Lieutenant Governor will be pleased to extend Such authority to the amount of Twenty five pounds, as after repeated enquiries, I find a Serviceable Horse cannot be obtained for less than Eighty to Eighty five pounds.
Foster forwarded the request to La Trobe for his appproval on 5 August. La Trobe responded: 'Appd'. The matter was then referred to the Auditor General who reported: 'I believe that a horse suited to this purpose cannot easily be got for less than £80 or £90— The provision will be exceeded'.
